Goblins are strange humanoid creatures that are said to of been born from the depths of the abyss itself, often traveling in packs or warbands, they are not to be underestimated for their resourcefulness, even by the strongest of adventurers.
Kobolds are small scaly, reptilian folk that usually hunt in packs, they are cold blooded unlike dragonfolk and are usually under the service of evil dragons, worshipping them with crude statues.

Bandits travel in gangs are usually led by bandit leaders or bandit veterans, typically bandit gangs roam the wilderness and outskirts of towns, looking for unsuspecting victims to rough up for spare coin.
Wolves are rarely seen alone, these pack predators are constantly found roaming the wilderness and occasionally can be found in caves. Many adventurer\'s have fallen to wolf ambushes.

Imps are known as demon tricksters, but more often than not are known as the lackeys of warlocks and wizards or other greater demon. Imps are the rabble that while aren\'t very intimidating on their own, can be quite a hastle with their shape changing magic.

Skeletons are said to be vengeful spirits that returned to their bodies long after their passing to enact vengeance on those who have wronged them. They are also summoned as lesser minions by necromancers and wizards to do their bidding, often against their will.

Zombies are often thralls raised from the dead by necromancers in order to carry out their bidding as meatshields and minions, often set upon innocent towns to bring back more bodies to make more zombies.
It is said that to every light there is a shadow, evil mages are no exception to good mages, often skulking in the shadows conducting vile rituals to cause harm to the innocent.
Traits: Nimble action: The goblin can hide or disengage as a bonus action every turn.
Traits: Pack Tactics: The kobolds have advantage on an Attack roll if at least one of the kobold\'s allies is within 5 ft of the creature.
Traits: None

Traits: Keen hearing and smell: Wolves have advantage on perception checks that require smelling or hearing.\nPack tactics: The wolf has advantage on any attack roll if atleast one of the wolves allies is within 5ft.

Traits: Shapechanger: The imp can use its action to Polymorph into a beast form that resembles a rat (speed 20 ft.), a raven (20 ft, fly 60 ft.), or a Spider (20 ft, climb 20 ft.), or back into its true form. Its Statistics are the same in each form, except for the speed changes noted. Any Equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies. 
Devil's Sight: Magical Darkness doesn't impede the imp's Darkvision. 
Magic Resistance: The imp has advantage on Saving Throws against Spells and other magical effects. 
Variant: Familiar: The imp can enter into a contract to serve another creature as a familiar, forming a Telepathic Bond with its willing master. While the two are bonded, the master can sense what the imp Senses as long as they are within 1 mile of each other. While the imp is within 10 feet of its master, the master shares the impâ€™s Magic Resistance trait. If its master violates the terms of the contract, the imp can end its service as a familiar, ending the Telepathic Bond. 
Invisibility: The imp magically turns Invisible until it attacks, or until its Concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any Equipment the imp wears or carries is Invisible with it.
Traits: Weakness to blunt: Takes double damage from bludgeoning damage and radiant damage. \nImmunities: Immune to poison, Exhaustion and takes half damage from slashing and piercing damage.

Traits: Undead Fortitude: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 Hit Points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5+the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead. \nImmunities: Immune to poison.

Traits: Evil Aura: Upon getting within 5Ft of the mage, make a DC10 Constitution saving through or be feared to move 5Ft backwards.\nTaste fear: Upon reducing a character to 0Hp, the dark mage feeds upon the fear of potential death, gaining temporary Hp equal to a quarter of that characters maximum Hp value.
Attacks: Melee attack: +4 to hit, reach 5ft, one target. Hit: 5 Slashing damage.\nRanged attack: +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft, one target. Hit: 5 Piercing damage.
Attacks: Melee attack: +4 to hit, reach 5ft, one target. Hit: 4 Piercing damage.\nRanged Attack: +4 to hit, reach 30/120ft, one target. Hit: 4 bludgeoning damage.

Attacks: Scimitar: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) slashing damage.\nLight Crossbow: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 80 ft./320 ft, one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.
Attacks: Bite attack: +4 to hit, reach 5ft, one target. Hit: 2d4 +2 piercing damage. If the target is a living creature, it must succeed on a DC 12 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

Attacks: Sting (Bite in Beast Form): Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage, and the target must make on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Attacks: Shortsword: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 5 piercing damage. \nShortbow: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft, one target. Hit: 5 piercing damage.
Attacks: Slam: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 3 bludgeoning damage.

Attacks: Quarterstaff. Melee Weapon Attack: +1 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 3 bludgeoning damage. \nEvil orb. Ranged spell attack: +2 to hit, reach 20ft, one target. Hit: 6 Arcane damage. \nCharm person: Ranged spell: Reach 30ft, one target. The target makes a DC13 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed on fail, the charmed target regards the caster as friendly for 2 turns and acts under the casters will or if the character makes a wisdom saving through.

blocked by a dark barrier!
encased in magical ice!
wandering mercenary who instructs the party to find the gem of magic banishment.
mysterious hooded man who offers to teach the spell to dispell magic, at a price.
rather strange barbarian who claims he can break the magic if he got his enchanted axe back from a nearby cave.
one of the demon kings lackey\'s!
an assassin sent to dispatch the party, and he brought friends!
an adventurer driven mad by wild magic, viewing you as evil to be purged.
west.
north.
east.

Map Generation

a dark stormy waterfront with an abandoned ruined port town in the distance.
a desolate wasteland, save for a few small caves and underground burrows by some strange creature.
an oddly dense forest, its as if eyes are watching you from within the treetops.
an old tattered cloth, belonging to their target along with footprints.
a trail of thick, black blood.
a magical rune that opens a teleport gate somewhere!
a dark, dank dungeon filled with skeletons and zombies!
a high tower hidden by floating in the sky above the clouds.
a deep underground cave, infested with lesser demons and kobolds.
summon a lich to assist them, must be stopped within 5 turns!
summon a flock of lesser imps to assist, must be stopped in 2 turns.
empower himself with the dark magic of his master, must be stopped in 3 turns.
the ritual portal activating again, revealing a portal to the item they seek\'s dungeon.
that upon defeating the villain, the ritual portal spat out several lesser demons under the control of the first hero they see, able to fly the party to their destination.
that the party would find a scroll of teleportation in the villain\'s backpack, able to transport the party to wherever they wish with one use.

Upon taking the first turn the party would be suddenly ambushed from both sides by ____
After successfully defending themselves against hte ambush, the party would find that something has changed within the dungeon, that change is ____
(Only start this once your satisfied with exploration) As the party emerges from the next room they would find that their target is awaiting them in the next room! That target being ____
As the foul adversary is defeated once and for all, and the treasure claimed, the party can finally return home and retire for now, the treasure being split up and the party would ___
north, a lit path.
east, a dim dark path.
west, a path that looks like the walls are crumbling.
skeleton marauders!
zombie thralls!
fire imps!
a teleport rune appeared underneath the party, warping them to the center of the labyrinth.
a hidden passageway opened up, leading to the labyrinth treasury.
a pitfall trap opens up under the party, sending them into the labyrinth\'s waterway.
the dark lord, Railak the terrible!
the great warlock of the labyrinth, Kozlik.
the evil wizard, Illath who used an ancient artifact to transform into a black dragon!
go their separate ways on their own adventures.
return home together and become lords and kings of their homeland.
set out on another adventure somewhere, adventure awaits those who look!
Thank you so much for using my application for this campaign, I hope you enjoyed it!
